description: Lenart Kova, frustrated by escalating distrust and rigid BCI lockdowns, secretly accesses the hidden system vault. He discovers Halden’s legacy spiral protocol alongside the root override for confession-based controls.

After weighing his options, Lenart decides to activate the spiral override. He discreetly transmits access keys and instructions to trusted neighborhood assembly organizers, allowing them to bypass central BCI control and issue community permits for services and movement.
Neighborhood assemblies begin issuing 'spiral permits,' granting residents access and mobility regardless of BCI score. The system rapidly gains popularity as word spreads across districts.
The Directorate mounts a coordinated attempt to shut down the spiral system. However, neighborhood assemblies organize collective resistance, preventing reinstatement of BCI restrictions.

With BCI authority fading and local cooperation thriving, Oksana Lintz publishes Halden’s original spiral system blueprints, helping assemblies formalize new, decentralized governance and marking the collapse of central Council control.
